reviewText: My wife and I love this show!  While it's clean, heartwarming and family friendly, (which is hard to find in itself) it is also well written, and acted with great actors that make you fall in love with there characters.  There's drama, conflict, humor, values, & it has a realness to it, that's so unlike other shows of this type. I am so glad that they released season 1, which we bought right away, but SO disappointed they are not planning to release anymore of this great, 4 season show!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was pleased to find the first season of Doc now available on DVD.  I would like to add my voice to all the others clamoring for the remaining seasons to be released on DVD, too.  This was a homespun series somewhat reminiscent of Little House On the Prairie and such, although very much updated and with a nice touch of humor added to the story of the western doc removed to the big city. While it didn't pretend to be great drama, everyone in it was good and it was a great showpiece for Cyrus, who fit the part naturally.  For a greatly underrated singer/songwriter, it was another sign that he has untapped talent.  I hope some day to see his musical ability given the recognition it deserves.
summary: Call It Corny But We Love It

reviewText: This series was very enjoyable and easy to watch with no sex, no profanity and no out-of-control violence.  Good wins over evil.  Good character is modeled and good values, like honesty, loyalty, and perseverance are demonstrated.  Each story is interesting. We looked forward to watching each episode.  With all the pain that there is in the world, we so much appreciated the focus on compassion and understanding.  It was wonderful to be uplifted and encouraged after viewing each story.  Our one disappointment is that Season 2 and the rest that follow have not been put on DVD for purchasing.  We hope that one day we'll discover that this has been done!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you like a show with moral values and real life situations, you'll be hooked. It is a wholesome, down to earth, family feel-good show.This is the series about a young country doctor from Montana; Dr. Clint Cassidy played by Billy Ray Cyrus, who goes to the big city, New York, and gets a position at the Westbury Clinic.How Doc's outlook on life, affects the people he comes into contact with, makes you want to run home form work and want the minute that the show starts to arrive. While Doc's homegrown charm and ethics are a delight to some of his college, to others he's a burr under their saddle.Doc brings up the wisdom bestowed upon him by the man that raised him, his interaction with some shady street vendors, and his way of handling the clinic red-tape to get sick people treatment, makes you want to smile inside.This is a pleasure to watch, and it saddened me when it was cancelled after five seasons. If you like "Touched by an Angel," "Highway to Heaven," and "Doctor Quinn, Medicine Woman" - you'll love this show!
summary: Refreshing, Wholesome and Just Plain Delightful!

reviewText: This is one of those rare tv series where you are entertained and if you aren't careful you might just learn a thing or two about life along the way.  I was never much of a fan of Billy Ray Cirus before I saw this show.  Now, I am a huge fan.  The quality of the episodes is just terrific.  In fact, the only flaw to this set is that it wasn't quickly followed by season 2 and so on..... That still puzzles me.This is one the whole family can sit down together and watch without having to explain objectionable material to the kids.  That's more and more rare these days.  Get this one.  You won't be disappointed.  It's top notch.  The simplicity of the message is very refreshing and the show has a very positive message without being preachy.  It's just good clean entertainment.I was excited to see it on DVD and bought an extra set to give as a gift.  Give one to someone you care about.  They will thank you for it, over and over.
summary: A fine family friendly drama series.  Great fun for all!

reviewerName: Penny Zeller, Christian Author and Speaker
reviewText: This series, peppered with faith, humor, and touching stories, stars Billy Ray Cyrus as a doctor who travels from his practice in small town Montana to New York. Taking a job in the big city, however, is no easy task for the cowboy who sees the good in people and always makes time for those in need of help.  A small town girl myself, I can only imagine how a move might make a huge impact on someone unaccustomed to city life.Viewers find themselves growing attached to the characters, who seem to come to life as they wrestle with everyday problems. Great lessons abound, including discussion of topics such as humility, greed, selfishness, putting others first, and the importance of faith no matter what our chosen profession. To me, this is one of the best series ever produced (I loved it almost as much as Sue Thomas, F.B. Eye). It is great for the entire family and contains nothing objectionable. My only question is...when are they going to bring Season 2 to DVD?! I am proud to add this movie to my Mom-Approved movie listing on my Wordpress blog.
